Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2017 09:30PM momoftwoboys wrote: Hi ladies I'M in the Shuswap. I found a lump, saw my doctor on Wednesday February 22. I had a diagnostic mammo and ultrasound on Friday February 24 and a core Biopsy Tuesday, February 28, all in Kamloops. 6 days. Very fast. Wondering how long is typical to wait for biopsy results. This lump is in same spot where another lump was excised and diagnosed as ADH five years ago.
Posts.Title: Live in B.C., 2.5 week wait for biopsy? Kimmer33 Kayla250

Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2011 01:23AM momoftwoboys wrote: I also am playing the waiting game.  I had an excisional biopsy on Oct 4.  I found a lump back in March and after a mammogram and an ultrasound I had a BiRad4 result.  Next was an ultrasound guided needle biopsy which came back inconclusive.  An MRI was suggested and failed (panic took over).  The radiologist suggested another ultrasound when there was 4 months since the first one on the time line.  That 2nd ultrasound happened August 2.  There was a change between the two ultrasounds and the radiologist suggested another needle biopsy.  At that point, I said enough is enough, just get this thing out of me.  So after 6 months of not knowing, I'm hoping I finally have some good news by the end of this week..... Mary 2011, I am happy for your B9 results :) Gloryof the '80's and Bapsplus5 I await your news of B9 results !
Posts.Title: Rollercoaster waiting for surgical biopsy results Babsplus5 momoftwoboys

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2011 03:58PM momoftwoboys wrote: Thanks Lme002 and Swaysings1 :)   I have been to the ADH thread.  Thanks for recommending it. Lots of support there :) I don't know if I like what I have been reading on the internet.  It would be more comforting if I had genetic imformation.   It's frustrating for me because I'm adopted and I do not know my medical history. I have inquired into having genetic testing but because I do not have family history, I do not meet the criteria.  It is suggested that I pay the 4000.00 for the test in the US.  patti

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2011 11:18PM momoftwoboys wrote: Glory of the 80's This is AWESOME news!  I'm so happy for you.  And I know exactly what you mean about having half your boobs removed.  I had a reduction done 30+ years ago.  You will have to be persistant now that irregularities on your mammograms are not going to be passed off as scar tissue.  Enjoy your new boobs :)  I loved the freedon I had after my reduction.  Go out and buy a sexy bra and celebrate!
